If you crash into the recorded craft, do its parts get damaged or destroyed? Just wondering, cause this would be great with the Skillful mod if it did

I just tried to use this mod to run a bit of a demo of a new tank.

Here's what I found:

Before firing a missile, I opted to "control from here" at the pod that is actually on the missile. When I fired and the missile detached, the mod correctly tracked the missile instead of the tank.

The missile has a "fragmentation warhead" that scatters prior to impact. This action was not tracked (the missile stayed in one piece all the way to the ground when replayed).

The missile did not actually collide with the ground, it stopped about 1m short and stayed in one piece. Sorry, no pretty explosions

I agree it would be awesome if this could be turned into a full replay function. It might be harder to do in KSP than FPS games, but DCS A10 has a replay function and it's certainly at least as computationally heavy as KSP. A big job for sure, but theoretically possible. Tracking the fragments of explosions might be a bit much, probably best to let regular KSP physics take over when an explosion occurs. This does raise possible problems (for example, one explosion might kick off debris that destroys a second object, but when replayed the explosion doesn't happen quite the same way and so you get a different result from the replay). But I still think it's worth it.

Edited March 23, 2014 by allmhuran
great mod!
Extremely interesting mod, but how heavy is it by curiosity ?

Heavy?

In terms of disk space, a whopping 63KB!

In terms of CPU use, probably pretty low, even with a bunch of replay vessels going. They have way less stuff going on than an actual vessel with lots of parts would.

GPU-wise it would be pretty similar though.

In terms of the weight of the data, based on the fact that a stored byte can be argued to have some incredibly tiny amount of mass, it comes in at around 0.000000000000000000000001 grams (Not kidding)

Thanks for this answer

I needed this information because my laptop is a bit just in term of resources for heavy mods and i prefer to be careful.

I'm extremely interested to record tracks as i drive quite a lot with rovers (at the current point i made nearly 500km) and i'm interested to follow the path i really used.

How does the mod behave to the F5 - F9 quicksaves - quickloads (happens relatively often when driving a rover) ?
It doesn't handle saves or loads at all, it just saves to it's own files as it wants. If you DO save or load while it's doing something, it's probably OK, but I never tried...

have you tried the texture reducer by BoulderCo ? it does all mods, and with the ton of mods I have ,My KSP runs just barely over 1gb , and yeah, this trails mod barely uses anything, and it rocks... I made some wacky stuff ,flew it in a pattern then made a sleek aircraft and tried to follow it...great stuff. Also I like it for landing trajectories ,so I don't go to (or near) the same place. as well as other uses... top notch!
